title: Injest error with docker-compose
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
- Clone the doccano repo from GitHub
- change to the cloned repo directory
- bring up Doccano with `docker-compose -f docker-compose.prod.yml`(omitting -d so all the logs get printed)
- log in as 'admin'
- create a text annotation project 'Test'
- choose file type JSONL
- copy the example text from the dialog to into a file test.json
- upload test.json (green box appears indicating the upload was successful)
- click 'Injest'

Expected:
Dataset is injested.

Actually:
Nothing happens in the UI. But in the container logs there is an error message from the backend:
```
backend_1   | Error moving temporary file to permanent storage location
nginx_1     | 10.116.60.121 - - [01/Jun/2021:15:41:58 +0000] "POST /v1/projects/1/upload HTTP/1.1" 500 145 "http://XXX/projects/1/upload" "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.15; rv:88.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/88.0" "-"
```

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04
*   Python Version Used: `Python 3.8.6 (default, Dec 11 2020, 14:38:29)`(in backend container)
*   When you install doccano: 01.06.2020
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): used the docker-compose.prod.yml file from the doccano repo
*   Docker Image versions:
*   *  rabbitmq:3.8
*   *  postgres:13.1-alpine
*   *  doccano images build from doccano git repo master commit cda25a68c3e7b6325c18f727f3b1b91703554faa
